excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:

Additional Tags: Irondad, Tony Stark Has A Heart, Precious Peter Parker, Trans Peter Parker, trans Spiderman, Marvel - Freeform, Tony Stark Acting as Peter Parker’s Parental Figure, slight angst, Angst with a Happy Ending, tony stark is a dad, Peter just needs someone to love him, hes scared, author is actually trans, FTM, Mild Language, Mild Transphobia, Peter Parker Needs a Hug, adoption fic, Adopted Peter Parker, spiderman homecoming - Freeform
Summary:

When Peter Parker gets kicked out, Tony Stark is there to help him back on his feet. It’s new, and comes with a lot of challenges, but Peter is worth it. He’d do anything to protect the kid and his secrets, but what happens when the whole world finds out what Peter spent his whole life trying to hide?

// In which Tony and Peter build a family

summary: I think that I wrote it properly this time,Just dont like when People use the wrong terms (bc not pedophilia). And I didnt try...
question: I think that I wrote it properly this time,Just dont like when People use the wrong terms (bc not pedophilia). And I didnt try to convice you for nothing lol for me  everybody believe and see the things as they want :) Just your other post annoys me a little, maybe you didnt mean that but it seemed like everybody must see them as father-son, when it is a headcanon by now. Byebye
answer:
Okay you know what? This IS a hill I will die on.

Starker is pedophilia! If you are shipping a 48-year-old man with a 15/16/17-year-old kid, you are shipping a pedophilia ship!
End story!

The only “wrong term” I used was saying Pedophilic vs Pedophilia, because I don’t think “pedophilic” is actually even a word.

But Starker is a pedophile ship and if you ship it you are disgusting and need to stop.

And I’m sorry, but… father/son is literally  canon. The Russo’s described the dynamic as being very father/son. This isn’t a headcanon, it’s canon.
But I also don’t care you see them more as big brother/little brother.

I literally only  care if you try to insist that your (general you, not you specifically anon) disgusting pedophile ship is a good thing!

tags: oh what bruce and nat as best friends??? wonderful!!!
summary: 19 buckytony 👀👀👀👀
question: 19 buckytony 👀👀👀👀
answer:
parents meeting when they’re taking their kids to class au 

you just hit a soft spot with me! 

Natasha was dragging Bucky by the arm to get to her class. She has made a new friend, which she won’t shut up about. His name is Bruce, he likes the color green, and science is his favorite. He can tell you anything you want to know about dinosaurs. 

Tony is also being dragged, because the teacher is assigning cubbies, and Bruce has to get one next to his Best Friend Ever Natasha. 

“Okay, okay,” Tony says with a laugh. Today is Open House Day, so he’ll get to see the teacher, other kids, and how Bruce interacts. 

He finds a model instead. His name is James Barnes, and he has Natasha as his daughter. Bruce and Natasha are talking about dinosaurs and ballet, and maybe a T-Rex doing ballet, and in the mean time, James smooth-talks his way into getting Tony’s number. 

Now…if only he could get a babysitter.

tags: idk what im doing but im having a great time tbh
summary: when he's six and in the hospital with bacterial pneumonia, death trails her fingers across his cheek, gentle and caring, and...
body:
when he’s six and in the hospital with bacterial pneumonia, death trails her fingers across his cheek, gentle and caring, and presses a kiss to his forehead. he can remember coughing, catching her hand in his as he sobbed through it.

he wants his mother, begs her to bring him his mother.

she just whispers a sad sigh and draws her hand over his face, sends him to sleep.

they let jarvis check him out of the hospital a week later.

—

he sees her again when he’s in his room, his breaths catching on sharp stabs of pain, the imprint of his father’s wrath wrapped around his torso. death holds his hand and whispers nonsense in a soothing tone.

he asks her why howard does this. she doesn’t answer, but her face looks a little sadder. she squeezes his hand before she leaves, skin warm in the room’s light.

he doesn’t tell his mother or jarvis about the bruises.

he thinks they know anyways.

—

she comes back when he’s almost twenty and his eyes are glazed, his arms bent to hide the marks in the crease of his elbow. the world feels wrong, distorted and false and he hates it, but not as much as he hates the static that buzzes through his head, loud and insistent.

death caresses the back of his head with one hand, nails painted with comical little skulls running over his scalp, as she guides a glass of water to his lips.

he passes out leaning against her, breathing following hers.

rhodey wakes him up the next morning and drags him to class.

—

he sees her again too soon, surrounded by empty bottles and misery, missing his mother and jarvis desperately.

when she picks him up, strong arms beneath his knees and shoulders, and carries him to his room, it’s the only time he thinks she might not be real. her hair is braided atop her head, tight and intricate and greying in some places.

she lets him cry into the dark fabric of her shirt and kisses the crown of his head like an apology.

he begs her to bring him his mother, like he had when he was still a child, tears in his eyes and voice desperate and broken.

he thinks she cries with him.

—

she shows up again hours after the bomb goes off, while they’re still operating, hands like fire within his chest. she cradles his head and brushes tears from his cheeks as he thrashes.

he had thought howard had taught him the meaning of pain. he was wrong.

when he wakes up she’s still there, eyes sad and tired, fingers in his hair.

she stays until he’s nearly done with the arc reactor, a calming presence in the shadows. while yinsen’s asleep he rests his head on her lap and sobs, asks why this is happening.

she doesn’t answer. she never answers.

—

he’s slumped against his desk, glass shards and blood in his hand alongside the original arc reactor, when she sweeps in with murder in her eyes. it’s the only time he’s ever seen her angry.

her hand, warm and dry, slips beneath his and helps him lift the glowing reactor, helps him slot it into the hole in his chest.

he gasps wetly, pain arcing through him, before he slumps back against the desk.

“thank you,” he whispers, watching her with tired eyes.

she smiles and nods and walks away.

—

when the lines reach his neck she comes back yet again, smelling like smoke and rain. he cries when he sees her, choking on his tears and the bitter taste of burning metal.

she hugs him, puts her chin atop his head, and speaks in a language he still can’t understand. when she pulls away, her fingers, nails painted pure white, trace the pattern of black poison across his skin.

“i’m dying,” he tells her, even and resigned, staring at the ceiling of his workshop.

he feels cold, the only points of warmth death’s hands upon his neck.

“i don’t know what to do.”

—

there’s a bloom of fire, the explosion spreading across the vast expanse of space, engulfing the emptiness. she blinks at him from the void, takes his hand as he drifts.

fear cloys in his lungs, catching on what air he still has. she pushes him, smiling, back towards the portal.

then he’s falling, faster and faster.

his eyes close and his heart stutters in his chest, just beneath the reactor.

—

she finds him in the bunker, just after rogers has left, and lays her hand just below where the shield had been driven into the armor. he can barely move, the suit too heavy without power, but he manages to shift the arm to lay across her foot, trying to blink away the tears in his eyes.

she speaks, and the sound is still twisted, unearthly, but he forgets to listen and can only see how her lips shape the words, ‘i’m sorry.’

she disappears before he falls asleep, the cold settling deep in his bones.

—

when thanos disappears, he sees her out of the corner of his eye, skin glowing in the red light of titan. she looks the same as always, and he feels tears form in his eyes.

he can feel blood coming from the wound in his stomach, he knows why she’s here. for once in his life he doesn’t want to go. everything is too much for a moment, overwhelming, before he meets her eyes and shakes his head.

he seals the wound and stands up, peter’s hands there to steady him.

she smiles, fond and bright, and something settles in his chest.

—

there’s dust on his hands, stuck there by his blood.

he feels sick when he turns to her, tears tracking lines through the grime on his face.

“please,” he begs, “please, no, you can’t.”

he is alone, and she watches him with tired eyes.

“please,” he repeats, curling in around his own hand, cradling it to his chest, “please.”

she doesn’t answer. she never answers.
body_abstract:
when he’s six and in the hospital with bacterial pneumonia, death trails her fingers across his cheek, gentle and caring, and presses a kiss to his forehead. he can remember coughing, catching her hand in his as he sobbed through it.

he wants his mother, begs her to bring him his mother.

she just whispers a sad sigh and draws her hand over his face, sends him to sleep.

they let jarvis check him out of the hospital a week later.

—

he sees her again when he’s in his room, his breaths catching on sharp stabs of pain, the imprint of his father’s wrath wrapped around his torso. death holds his hand and whispers nonsense in a soothing tone.

he asks her why howard does this. she doesn’t answer, but her face looks a little sadder. she squeezes his hand before she leaves, skin warm in the room’s light.

he doesn’t tell his mother or jarvis about the bruises.

he thinks they know anyways.

[[MORE]]

—

she comes back when he’s almost twenty and his eyes are glazed, his arms bent to hide the marks in the crease of his elbow. the world feels wrong, distorted and false and he hates it, but not as much as he hates the static that buzzes through his head, loud and insistent.

death caresses the back of his head with one hand, nails painted with comical little skulls running over his scalp, as she guides a glass of water to his lips.

he passes out leaning against her, breathing following hers.

rhodey wakes him up the next morning and drags him to class.

—

he sees her again too soon, surrounded by empty bottles and misery, missing his mother and jarvis desperately.

when she picks him up, strong arms beneath his knees and shoulders, and carries him to his room, it’s the only time he thinks she might not be real. her hair is braided atop her head, tight and intricate and greying in some places.

she lets him cry into the dark fabric of her shirt and kisses the crown of his head like an apology.

he begs her to bring him his mother, like he had when he was still a child, tears in his eyes and voice desperate and broken.

he thinks she cries with him.

—

she shows up again hours after the bomb goes off, while they’re still operating, hands like fire within his chest. she cradles his head and brushes tears from his cheeks as he thrashes.

he had thought howard had taught him the meaning of pain. he was wrong.

when he wakes up she’s still there, eyes sad and tired, fingers in his hair.

she stays until he’s nearly done with the arc reactor, a calming presence in the shadows. while yinsen’s asleep he rests his head on her lap and sobs, asks why this is happening.

she doesn’t answer. she never answers.

—

he’s slumped against his desk, glass shards and blood in his hand alongside the original arc reactor, when she sweeps in with murder in her eyes. it’s the only time he’s ever seen her angry.

her hand, warm and dry, slips beneath his and helps him lift the glowing reactor, helps him slot it into the hole in his chest.

he gasps wetly, pain arcing through him, before he slumps back against the desk.

“thank you,” he whispers, watching her with tired eyes.

she smiles and nods and walks away.

—

when the lines reach his neck she comes back yet again, smelling like smoke and rain. he cries when he sees her, choking on his tears and the bitter taste of burning metal.

she hugs him, puts her chin atop his head, and speaks in a language he still can’t understand. when she pulls away, her fingers, nails painted pure white, trace the pattern of black poison across his skin.

“i’m dying,” he tells her, even and resigned, staring at the ceiling of his workshop.

he feels cold, the only points of warmth death’s hands upon his neck.

“i don’t know what to do.”

—

there’s a bloom of fire, the explosion spreading across the vast expanse of space, engulfing the emptiness. she blinks at him from the void, takes his hand as he drifts.

fear cloys in his lungs, catching on what air he still has. she pushes him, smiling, back towards the portal.

then he’s falling, faster and faster.

his eyes close and his heart stutters in his chest, just beneath the reactor.

—

she finds him in the bunker, just after rogers has left, and lays her hand just below where the shield had been driven into the armor. he can barely move, the suit too heavy without power, but he manages to shift the arm to lay across her foot, trying to blink away the tears in his eyes.

she speaks, and the sound is still twisted, unearthly, but he forgets to listen and can only see how her lips shape the words, ‘i’m sorry.’

she disappears before he falls asleep, the cold settling deep in his bones.

—

when thanos disappears, he sees her out of the corner of his eye, skin glowing in the red light of titan. she looks the same as always, and he feels tears form in his eyes.

he can feel blood coming from the wound in his stomach, he knows why she’s here. for once in his life he doesn’t want to go. everything is too much for a moment, overwhelming, before he meets her eyes and shakes his head.

he seals the wound and stands up, peter’s hands there to steady him.

she smiles, fond and bright, and something settles in his chest.

—

there’s dust on his hands, stuck there by his blood.

he feels sick when he turns to her, tears tracking lines through the grime on his face.

“please,” he begs, “please, no, you can’t.”

he is alone, and she watches him with tired eyes.

“please,” he repeats, curling in around his own hand, cradling it to his chest, “please.”

she doesn’t answer. she never answers.

trail.content_raw:
when he’s six and in the hospital with bacterial pneumonia, death trails her fingers across his cheek, gentle and caring, and presses a kiss to his forehead. he can remember coughing, catching her hand in his as he sobbed through it.

he wants his mother, begs her to bring him his mother.

she just whispers a sad sigh and draws her hand over his face, sends him to sleep.

they let jarvis check him out of the hospital a week later.

—

he sees her again when he’s in his room, his breaths catching on sharp stabs of pain, the imprint of his father’s wrath wrapped around his torso. death holds his hand and whispers nonsense in a soothing tone.

he asks her why howard does this. she doesn’t answer, but her face looks a little sadder. she squeezes his hand before she leaves, skin warm in the room’s light.

he doesn’t tell his mother or jarvis about the bruises.

he thinks they know anyways.

[[MORE]]

—

summary: Highway to Hell
title: Highway to Hell
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2M0R2Ua

by jellybeanforest

It’s a long road back to Earth, but that’s barely enough time for Nebula and Kraglin to hash out who deserves the most blame as they come to terms with the deaths of their siblings in the aftermath of the Snap.

For Nebula Week 2018 Day 2 - Family

Words: 2524, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe, Guardians of the Galaxy (Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Nebula (Marvel), Kraglin Obfonteri, Tony Stark
  • Relationships: Nebula & Kraglin Obfonteri
  • Additional Tags: Post Infinity War, Road Trip, Blame Game, Siblings, Hurt/Comfort, platonic comfort, Background Starmora - Freeform, Hints of Past Ambiguous Kragdu, Pre-Kragula if you squint, Peter Quill Discourse, Nebula-Centric, Nebula Week 2018


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2M0R2Ua

tags: avac tony is as obnoxious as possible
he is totes the type of thot to wear high heeled sneakers
this costume is half inspired by your art so there is that
summary: hey dudes, help me out a bit here? I found these rad ass shoes and i’m gonna paint em to be ironman shoes heh. I colored in the...
caption:
hey dudes, help me out a bit here?

I found these rad ass shoes and i’m gonna paint em to be ironman shoes heh. I colored in the photo with some ideas, which do you think is the coolest? Personally i’m leaning towards option 4?

These will be for my avengers academy tony cosplay so lol the cartoony bright colors are p accurate actually. And i’ll probably be wearing them with black leggings, black thigh high socks, or maybe yellow scrunchy socks? and black shorts. 

or, if anyone has any other combinations they think would look better hit me up! describe to me your idea?

summary: A Week To Remember (A Week To Forget)
title: A Week To Remember (A Week To Forget)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2AMVX5Z

by DobbyRocksSocks

summary: I Want U Back || Starker
title: I Want U Back || Starker
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2M13MKf

by DesahogoWriten

Peter Parker esta harto que Thompson lo moleste con su físico que para callarle la boca le demostrara que puede calentar a varios si se lo propone, pero ¿Tony soportara verlo intentarlo?

Words: 2919, Chapters: 1/3, Language: Español

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Tony Stark, Michelle Jones, Harry Osborn, Ned Leeds, May Parker, Flash Thompson

blog.name: marvelficrec
blog.title: Marvel Fic Recs
blog.description:
A blog dedicated to finding all the best Tony Stark centric fic recs. Feel free to request what you want using the ask box! I specialize in stevetony, buckytony, and stevebuckytony.
check out the master lists!
angst | fluff | smut

tags: there is a serious lack of college and high school winteriron
summary: Hi I hope you're feeling better! I was wondering if you had any more college/university fics?
question: Hi I hope you're feeling better! I was wondering if you had any more college/university fics?
answer:
yes, thank you for stopping by for more! for anyone who hasn’t read through the first list, check it out right here! and thank you anon <3

stevetony:
Love Is An Anomaly (Not Science Nor Art) - 45k - LOVE this fic, BUT steve technically is a teacher (but not tony’s)

Run - 6k - cute

His Fate Will Be Unlearned - 92k - meh.

Physics 101 - 19k - tony is steve’s teacher, but its not weird cause tony’s only like 19 and def doesn’t want to be a teacher

Through A Lens - 4k

You Never Forget Your First - 28k

Revenge Is Sweet (Love Is Sweeter) - 2k - the typical “lets pretend to date to prank our friends”, they never stood a chance, FOOLS

The Wi-Fi Thief - 1k

I’m Sketchy and You Sketch - 3k

Guaraldi’s Christmas Lessons - ficlet

red lips, whiskey sips, shaking hips, nipple slips. my life as a rap song. - 2k

buckytony:

Clouds - 9k - past stevetony

New Tattoo - 7k

You - 4k - this fic is so fucked up. tony’s a cheating douchebag, Steve’s a cheating douchebag, idk man

stevetonybucky:

Breakthrough - 3k

send more fic requests!
